channel.title: Finance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Finance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Small businesses say Trump tariffs are hurting this group of consumers this holiday season—here’s what is getting more expensive
item.description: Consumers' estimated gift budgets decreased $229 between October and November, according to a Gallup index.

item.title: ‘Escape From Tarkov’ Sells Over A Million Copies In First Month
item.description: Escape From Tarkov has sold over a million copies since launching last month, and to celebrate players can unlock an in-game reward.

item.title: New York Approves Casino Sites—With Trump And Billionaire Steve Cohen Standing To Gain
item.description: The state’s Gaming Facility Board approved the casinos earlier this month before passing recommendations to the Gaming Commission for the final vote.

item.title: iOS 26.2: Apple Issues Critical Update For Millions Of iPhones In Unprecedented Release
item.description: After rumors of delays, the next iPhone update is here, right on time. Here’s why the new update is important.

item.title: Rivian CEO says the EV maker’s new large driving model will one day allow for fully autonomous driving—and maybe a spot in the robotaxi race
item.description: “Our initial focus will be on personally owned vehicles," RJ Scaringe said. But "this also enables us to pursue opportunities in the rideshare space."

item.title: Former Meta integrity chief says new report reveals ‘disappointing’ ad fraud epidemic at the social-media giant
item.description: An internal audit warned of systemic corruption, yet Meta expanded Chinese ad partnerships that generated billions—much of it tied to fraud.

item.title: ‘We are now firmly back in a good is bad/bad is good regime’: Weak job data may lead to more rate cuts and boost stocks, Morgan Stanley economist says
item.description: Morgan Stanley’s top strategist Michael Wilson noted the labor market, more so than inflation, has become a crucial factor in determining future monet...

item.title: Energy secretary says electricity prices will drop under Trump administration policies
item.description: Energy Secretary Chris Wright said that President Donald Trump's pro-energy policies will stop rising electricity prices and eventually reduce costs d...

item.title: Cryptocurrency Billionaire’s Space Startup In Talks For $2 Billion Valuation
item.description: Jed McCaleb, who made billions from blockchain networks Ripple and Stellar, has been Vast’s primary funder to date.

item.title: First-Ever Humanoid Robot App Store Launches So You Can Make Your Robot Dance And Fight
item.description: There's an app for everything. And everything has an App Store. Including, now, humanoid robots, courtesy of Unitree.

item.title: Trump vows to fight ‘fraud’ in SNAP benefits for 42 million Americans
item.description: “It's always something that goes wrong,” Jamal Brown, a 41-year-old food stamp participant said, “unfortunately.”

item.title: U.S. stocks end lower as rotation trade continues
U.S. stocks remain lower in final hour of trading. Follow the updates here.
Two Fed officials who rarely agree both say inflation fears have cooled
Analyst takes ‘contrarian stance’ on Costco’s stock and says it’s time to sell

Powell says he wants to 'turn this job over' with economy in 'really good shape' before departure
item.description: Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell wants to leave office with inflation at 2% and strong job market when his term ends in May 2026, avoiding legacy t...

item.title: Bessent expects taxpayers will see 'very large' tax refunds early next year
item.description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said American households could receive substantial $1,000-$2,000 tax refunds in early 2026 under OBBBA tax law change...

item.title: Powell says rate cuts won't make 'much of a difference' for struggling housing sector
item.description: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell warned that housing market struggles will persist despite rate cuts, citing low inventory and affordability cha...

item.title: ‘This place will win’: Business leaders say West Palm Beach is becoming America’s next big boomtown
item.description: West Palm Beach has evolved from its retirement haven days, as tech firms, financial giants and entrepreneurs flock to one of the country's most sough...

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
